results.title: Nevil the ninja
results.creator_credit: John Bird, Grant Noble and David Atkinson
results.brief_description: It’s show and tell day at school and a young girl recites a poem in front of the whole class recounting the exploits of Nevil Ninja, master of the ancient and dubious art of Ninjutsu and the story of his defeat against a very little girl.

results.title: Jawpan
results.brief_description: Otaku and his robot friend Knowbot stumble across an evil force when out for a good time at th e”Nice Life” ATM. When the world is threatened with destruction by a “type 1 error”, Otaku and Knowbot must save the day by re-initialising planet earth.

results.title: Icaros
results.creator_credit: Amos Winikoff, John Bird and David Atkinson
results.brief_description: An adaptation to film of an exercise in dance and music. The animation reveals new aspects of what was an event of true improvisation. A hand drawn dance sequence which revolves around elements of the sun, light, and joy.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Amos Winikoff, John Bird and David Atkinson

results.title: Harry Bachelor
results.brief_description: Harry Bachelor loves his city, loves his life…until, a lone parking meter with canabalistic tendencies inhabits his street. While Harry tries to cope, the trying meter swells in greed and size to become a larger than life sparring partner. Will Harry fight this all the way to City Hall? or will Harry snap under the strain adopting uncharacteristic behaviour?

results.title: Blue
results.brief_description: Travellers crossing a post-apolcalyptic landscape unearth a time capsule containing the accumulated wealth and knowledge of a now extinct society (ours). They are now faced with a cruel dilemma: should they study this ancient civilization or simply consume its last remaining treasures?

results.title: Alex and the beast within
results.creator_credit: David Atkinson, John Bird and Dominic O'Brien
results.brief_description: Cities are a hard place, some say they’re filled with sharks. One man haunted by this belief disappears into his fantasy emerging with the realisation that perhaps there are dragons too.

results.title: Jem Cohen: early works
results.brief_description: A rich and haunting collection of early works from an artist who paints with fragments of image and sound from New York street life. Dogs, passing cars, the homeless, drugged and alienated people drift through these works, in the rhythms of their own time. Simple mysteries are uncovered through a window, in half deserted streets, and in wind blown garbage. Voices become confessions, shadows become cinematic and we are absorbed and compiled into a world of wonder, in which people inevitably leave traces - and lists.
results.description: A rich and haunting collection of early works from an artist who paints with fragments of image and sound from New York street life. Dogs, passing cars, the homeless, drugged and alienated people drift through these works, in the rhythms of their own time. Simple mysteries are uncovered through a window, in half deserted streets, and in wind blown garbage. Voices become confessions, shadows become cinematic and we are absorbed and compiled into a world of wonder, in which people inevitably leave traces - and lists.

group_works.title: Just hold still. Parts one and two

group_works.title: This is a history of New York

results.title: This is a history of New York
results.brief_description: ‘This is a History of New York’ chronicles the seven ages of mankind from Prehistory to the Space Age. In the Age of Hunters and Gatherers, stray dogs patrol the streets while the homeless forage for food. Later in the Medieval Period, crazed street preachers pace frantically before ominous gothic architecture. The richness of Cohen’s vision is found in this haunting imagery and the perception that the thriving city of New York is really the accumulation of humanity’s failures, as well as triumphs.
results.title_for_label: This is a history of New York

group_siblings.material_description: Single channel moving image, black and white and colour and audio

results.title: Just hold still. Parts one and two
results.material_description: Single channel moving image, black and white and colour and audio
results.brief_description: In his New York City Landscape, Cohen finds inspiration in disturbance. Looking to life for rhythm and to architecture for state of mind, he locates simple mysteries. `Just Hold Still’ is comprised of an interconnected series of short works and collaborations that explore the grey area between documentary, narrative and experimental genres. Part One concerns a personal, poetic approach to narrative while Part Two involves hybridized use of verite footage and the confrontation of documentary concerns with the music video format. The work can be considered as a whole or each piece in the project can be viewed (and rented) as a separate entity.
